chrome_user_data_folders_label_text: Paths to Chrome user data folders
max_number_of_history_records_label_text: Maximum number of records in changes history
locales_whitelist_label_text: Locales to show in locale selects
enable_analytics_label_text: Allow Chrome Theme Creator to send anonymous usage information
option_stretch_browser_text: Stretch to fit the browser window
open_in_chrome_btn_title: Open in Chrome (left-click = normal mode, right-click = incognito mode, middle-click = normal mode + incognito mode)
clear_new_tab_link_text: ‚öóÔ∏è Remove Google stuff from new tab with Clear New Tab Chrome extension
donate_link_text: üíñ Support the development of this app by donating any amount via PayPal
analytics_privacy_message_text: Do you want to allow Chrome Theme Creator to send anonymous usage information to Google Analytics for product improvement purposes? (can be changed later in options)
theme_metadata_name_help_text: Theme name displayed in the Chrome Web Store.
theme_metadata_description_help_text: Theme short description displayed in the Chrome Web Store.
theme_metadata_locale_help_text: Currently edited language of theme's name and description.
theme_metadata_default_locale_help_text: Fallback language displayed to users in whose language a theme is not translated.
theme_metadata_icon_help_text: Theme icon displayed in the Chrome Web Store.
images_help_text: Images that covers differrent parts of the browser. "Background image" can be in png, jpg or gif format. All other images elements can only be in png format.
images_theme_ntp_background_help_text:
Recommended Width x Height: 1920 x 1080.
This is the image that is displayed at the large white space in the browser, in the new tab page. It can be semi-transparent. There are two ways you can create the inner background for the browser-use: a large image without repetition/tiling or use a small image that repeats in x-axis and/or y-axis (see "Background image repeat"). There is also option for you to select the alignment of this image, by default the image is center aligned, but you may choose to align it the way you want (see "Background image position"). Please note that when you preview a theme in incognito mode "Background image" will not be visible in three automatically opened tabs. To see it open new tab manually. If you create solid color image for this element "Background image repeat" will be automatically set to "Repeat".
images_theme_toolbar_help_text:
Recommended Width x Height: ‚àû x 140.
This is an image that covers the area of the current tab and the toolbar below it. Similar to the "Frame", this image also tiles along the x-axis so you have the option to create pattern or create a looong width image for the toolbar. Remember that the toolbar contains some buttons and when the bookmarks are visible (CMD+B or Ctrl+B), they too occupy space in the toolbar: So don't make the design too much crowded, or else the toolbar will not be visually appealing.
images_theme_frame_help_text:
Recommended Width x Height: ‚àû x 60.
This image represents the area behind the tabs. It would be helpful to know that this image repeats along the x-axis, so you can create patterns if you use short sized images. Alternatively one can decide to create an image with loooong width - long enough that the image repetition is not seen - this method allows you to create one continuous design for the frame.
images_theme_frame_inactive_help_text:
Recommended Width x Height: ‚àû x 60.
This image represents the area behind the tabs, when the chrome window is out of focus/inactive. All that is applicable to "Frame", applies to this. Usually to avoid making the theme heavy, you can go for "Frame (inactive)" tint, to show that the window is inactive - it's more efficient than creating a whole new image. But it's up to the designer to decide, if it's going to be an image separately for the inactive state or there is going to be a color tint when the window is inactive.
images_theme_frame_incognito_help_text:
Recommended Width x Height: ‚àû x 60.
This is similar to the "Frame", but this image represents the frame of a window in incognito mode. You may choose to redesign the image specially for the incognito mode or ignore this, so that whatever you made for "Frame" will be tinted (see "Frame (incognito)" tint) and used in incognito mode (it's by default that it gets a dark tint in incognito mode).
images_theme_frame_incognito_inactive_he:
Recommended Width x Height: ‚àû x 80.
This is similar to "Frame (inactive)", but this image is for the inactive frame of a window in incognito mode.
images_theme_frame_overlay_help_text:
Recommended Width x Height: ‚àû x 60.
This is the image that will be displayed at the top left corner of the frame, over the "Frame" image. Also this image doesn't repeats by default. Hence this image may be used in case you don't want the frame area design to repeat.
images_theme_frame_overlay_inactive_help:
Recommended Width x Height: ‚àû x 60.
This is similar to "Frame overlay", but will be displayed when the browser window is inactive.
images_theme_tab_background_help_text:
Recommended Width x Height: ‚àû x 60.
This image represents all the inactive tabs. Usually a less saturated image of "Toolbar" is used for this. You may also design something else, but make sure that the design enables the user to distinguish the inactive tabs from the active one! This image also tiles by default in x-axis. If you make this image semi-transparent, then the "Frame" image will be visible under it.
images_theme_tab_background_inactive_hel:
Recommended Width x Height: ‚àû x 60.
This image represents all the inactive tabs, when the chrome window is out of focus/inactive.
images_theme_tab_background_incognito_he:
Recommended Width x Height: ‚àû x 60.
This image represents the inactive tabs in the incognito mode.
images_theme_tab_background_incognito_in:
Recommended Width x Height: ‚àû x 60.
This image represents all the inactive tabs, but this image is for the inactive frame of a window in incognito mode.
images_theme_window_control_background_h:
Recommended Width x Height: ‚àû x 60.
This image specifies the background for the window control buttons (minimize, maximize, close). This image is not necessary until you desperately need to change the control button background. If this image is not included, the control buttons assume the background color specified in the color element "Window controls".
images_theme_ntp_attribution_help_text:
Recommended Width x Height: Any but not too large.
An image that is displayed at the bottom right corner of the new tab page. Chrome automatically puts a heading "Theme created by:" and below that displays whatever image you give as attribution. A good practice is to create a small png file enough for an author name (and contact if needed) with alpha transparency background. Making large and more color intense image will attract view. If "Background image" is not set this element will not be displayed.
colors_help_text: Color elements changes color of different parts of the browser.
colors_ntp_background_help_text: Specifies the color of the background of the new tab page.
colors_toolbar_help_text: Specifies the color of the area of the current tab, toolbar below it, downloads bar and status bar.
colors_frame_help_text: Specifies the color of the frame area of the browser (the area behind the tabs).
colors_frame_inactive_help_text: Specifies the color of the frame area of the browser (the area behind the tabs) but when the window is inactive/out of focus.
colors_frame_incognito_help_text: This is a color element similar to "Frame", but under the incognito mode.
colors_frame_incognito_inactive_help_tex: This is a color element similar to "Frame (inactive)", but under the incognito mode.
colors_background_tab_help_text: Specifies the color of all the inactive tabs.
colors_background_tab_inactive_help_text: Specifies the color of all the inactive tabs but when the window is inactive/out of focus.
colors_background_tab_incognito_help_tex: This is a color element similar to "Inactive tabs", but under the incognito mode.
colors_background_tab_incognito_inactive: This is a color element similar to "Inactive tabs (inactive)", but under the incognito mode.
colors_bookmark_text_help_text: Specifies the color of the text of bookmarks in the toolbar and the text for the downloads bar.
colors_tab_text_help_text: Specifies the color of the title text of the current tab and the text in the status bar.
colors_tab_background_text_help_text: Specifies the color of the title text of all the inactive tabs.
colors_tab_background_text_inactive_help: Specifies the color of the title text of all the inactive tabs but when the window is inactive/out of focus.
colors_tab_background_text_incognito_hel: This is a color element similar to "Inactive tabs text", but under the incognito mode.
colors_tab_background_text_incognito_ina: This is a color element similar to "Inactive tabs text (inactive)", but under the incognito mode.
colors_button_background_help_text: Specifies the background color of the window control buttons (minimize, maximize, close).
colors_ntp_text_help_text: Specifies the color of the background area of shortcuts on hover. Can be only white or black. This element also determines color of top right items (Gmail, Images etc.).
tints_help_text: Tint elements change the hue, saturation and lightness of images. To disable specefic tint element click "Disabled" checkbox.
tints_frame_help_text: Specifies a color tint for the frame area. Whatever image you've created for the frame area will be tinted with a color that you specify here.
tints_frame_inactive_help_text: Specifies a color tint for the frame area when the window is inactive/out of focus.
tints_frame_incognito_help_text: Specifies a color tint for the frame area in incognito mode.
tints_frame_incognito_inactive_help_text: Specifies a color tint for the frame area in incognito mode, but when the window is inactive/out of focus.
tints_background_tab_help_text: Specifies the color tint of the inactive tabs.
tints_buttons_help_text: Specifies a color tint for icons inside all the buttons in the toolbar (back, forward, refresh,etc.).
properties_help_text: Property elements change how images are displayed.
properties_ntp_background_alignment_help: Controls the alignment of the background image.
properties_ntp_background_repeat_help_te: Controls the repeat of the background image.
properties_ntp_logo_alternate_help_text: Specifies the color of the Google logo in new tab.
clear_new_tab_help_text: Clear New Tab elements change the background image/video settings in the Clear New Tab Chrome extension.
clear_new_tab_clear_new_tab_video_help_t: This is the video that is displayed in new tab instead of a background image. Note that this video will not be displayed when you previewing a theme from Chrome Theme Creator, it will be displayed only when you install a theme from the Chrome Web Store with the Clear New Tab installed and running in "Theme background" mode. "Background video" can be in mp4, webm or ogg format.
clear_new_tab_video_volume_help_text: Volume of the video that you upload above. This value will be applied to the video when you install a theme from the Chrome Web Store with the Clear New Tab installed and running in "Theme background" mode.
clear_new_tab_size_help_text: Size of the background image or video that you upload above. This value will be applied to the image/video when you install a theme from the Chrome Web Store with the Clear New Tab installed and running in "Theme background" mode. Recommended value: Cover the screen.
options_chrome_exe_paths_help_text: Paths to Chrome executables separated by commas. Used to preview themes in the separate user profile (see "Paths to Chrome user data folders" help). For example if you have Stable and Canary channel installed you can put in this text input executable to Stable channel if you wish to preview themes with it. Example: C:\Program Files (x86)\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe, C:\Program Files (x86)\Google\Chrome Beta\Application\chrome.exe
options_chrome_user_data_folders_help_te: Paths to Chrome user data folders separated by commas. Each given path will create a button in the header next to "Open in Chrome" button. When you click on one of these buttons Chrome will be opened in the separate user profile with theme installed. If folder doesnt exist it will be created on the first preview. You can specify Chrome executable for each user data folder (see "Paths to Chrome executables" above). Example: D:\dev-chrome\chrome-dev-en, D:\dev-chrome\chrome-dev-ru
options_custom_folders_help_text: Paths to any folders separated by commas. Each given path will create a button in the header next to "New Theme" button. When you click on one of these buttons the folder and all of its content will be recreated in the selected folder. Example: C:\Custom Chrome Theme Creator folders, D:\Custom Chrome Theme Creator folders
options_max_number_of_history_records_he: Set to 0 to disable changes history.
options_locales_whitelist_help_text: Language codes of languages that you want to see in "Locale" and "Default locale" selects, separeted by commas. Example: en, ru, fr
choose_folder_tutorial_item_text: Choose a folder where all your themes are/will be stored.
select_folder_tutorial_item_text: Regular folders are marked with white (black if you have chosen the light ui theme in the options) color. Themes are marked with blue color. Select the folder where new theme will be stored.
open_in_chrome_tutorial_item_text: Open theme in Chrome by left-clicking on this button. Right-click to open theme in an incognito mode.
pack_tutorial_item_text: Package theme as a zip file for distribution in the Chrome Web Store. The package will be stored in the folder that contains theme.
chosen_folder_is_not_theme_er: Chosen folder is not a theme
pak_is_locked_er: Can't delete Cached Theme.pak file because it's locked
zip_is_locked_er: Can't delete *.zip file because it's locked
crx_is_locked_er: Can't delete *.crx file because it's locked
pem_is_locked_er: Can't delete *.pem file because it's locked
img_is_locked_er: Can't delete the image because it's locked
locale_is_locked_er: Can't delete locale folder because it's locked
cant_create_theme_in_theme_er: Can't create a theme in a theme
cant_show_folder_er: Can't show folder because you didn't select any folder
cant_open_folder_er: Can't open folder because you didn't select any folder
app_close_msg: Are you sure you want to quit Chrome Theme Creator?
